title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 18 October 2012 - XWiki
content:
<xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
16:33 <vmassol> hello bot  
16:33 <vmassol> !news  
16:34 <vmassol> XWIKI-1000  
16:34 <vmassol> !search test  
16:34 <vmassol> !jira test  
16:34 <vmassol> :)  
16:35 <vmassol> ah I need to turn that off :)  
16:35 <vmassol> or not...  
16:36 <vmassol> hmmm  
16:37 <vmassol> ok 401 needs to be excluded  
16:41 <mflorea> has quit  
16:43 <vmassol> contributors, here's some nice way to help the xwiki project:  
16:43 <vmassol> edit the pages containing those broken links and replace with valid links  
16:44 <vmassol> :)  
16:44 <vmassol> cdop, Inge-, coud5, dirk\_schmitt :)  
16:44 <vmassol> (and others too ofc)  
16:45 <vmassol> !bl  
16:46 <vmassol> my new rule: before answering a question asked by a user he needs to fix a broken link somewhere :)  
16:56 <coud5> vmassol how does the broken links plugin works ? For example 2nd link from bottom is not broken. On the page it has dot at the end of the link (https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/sandbox/blob/master/authenticators/.), but it points to location without dot at the end (https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/sandbox/blob/master/authenticators/)  
16:59 <vmassol> coud5: there's a dot at the end  
16:59 <coud5> ah, my bad link contains the "." too  
16:59 <vmassol> which is why it's invalid  
16:59 <coud5> chrome removes it  
16:59 <vmassol> the solution is to write:  
16:59 <tmortagne> ha this one is my fault  
16:59 <vmassol> [[url:<…..>]].  
16:59 <tmortagne> funny that it works  
17:00 <tmortagne> fixing it  
17:00 <vmassol> yeah strange, maybe the browser removes the dot at the end  
17:00 <tmortagne> vmassol: or github redirect  
17:00 <tmortagne> that would not be correct to remove the . so I hope the browser does not do it  
17:01 <tmortagne> . is perfectly valid in a URL  
17:02 <vmassol> when I hover over in my browser with my mouse  
17:02 <vmassol> it gives a URL without the dot  
17:02 <vmassol> which is why I said it must be the browser  
17:05 <Slashman> has quit  
17:05 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
17:06 <eshan> has quit  
17:06 <eshan> has joined #xwiki  
17:07 <vmassol> fyi btw broken links are only sent once every hour  
17:07 <vmassol> so after 1 hour they'll start being listed again if someone hits them  
17:07 <vmassol> going to work on converting the old archives to the new format now  
17:07 <tmortagne> you tested before I fix it ?  
17:08 <vmassol> yes  
17:08 <vmassol> I still have it in my browser  
17:08 <tmortagne> indeed FF seems to remove the . at the ends  
17:08 <tmortagne> sounds weird  
17:08 <vmassol> (haven't refreshed yet)  
17:08 <tmortagne> would need to check the spec  
17:08 <tmortagne> if the browser does not keep the . maybe we should not  
17:09 <vmassol> IMO it's a convenience feature only and not part of the spec  
17:09 <vmassol> but indeed we should check  
17:09 <tmortagne> if it's not part of the spec that would make it a bug of the browser IMO  
17:09 <tmortagne> would mean it's not supporting something valid  
17:09 <vmassol> yeah but since it saves everyone it's still interesting to have that for them  
17:10 <vmassol> the dot can be url -escaped if it's really needed I guess  
17:10 <tmortagne> sure but I doubt we escape it for example when generating a URL with a . at the end of the page name for example  
17:10 <tmortagne> that would make it not work  
17:10 <tmortagne> checking  
17:12 <tmortagne> hmm the wiki editor is completely broken on http://tuska.myxwiki.org  
17:13 <tmortagne> the XAR is not up to date but editor is template stuff  
17:15 <tmortagne> vmassol: I can reproduce the same issue on several subwikis on myxwiki.org  
17:16 <vmassol> indeed  
17:16 <vmassol> restarting  
17:20 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
17:21 <vmassol> myxwiki.org is real slow to restart...  
17:21 <vmassol> ok done  
17:21 <vmassol> works now  
17:21 <vmassol> not good....  
17:21 <vmassol> we need to update it to 4.3M1 next week when it's released  
17:21 <vmassol> we still need a Release Manager for 4.3M1 guys...  
17:22 <vmassol> !search Roster  
17:22 <vmassol> see http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/BuildManagerRoster  
17:22 <vmassol> oops  
17:22 <vmassol> the other one  
17:22 <vmassol> http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/ReleaseManagerRoster  
17:23 <vmassol> Enygma`, Denis, you should beef up your stats ;)  
17:24 <vmassol> evalica: wikis on myxwiki.org have the blurred issue too  
17:24 <vmassol> evalica: when we upgrade to 4.3M1 will it be fixed automatically?  
17:26 <Denis> vmassol: sorry, it would have been with pleasure, but I do not have anytime available currently. Hope you will have better luck with Enygma` :)  
17:26 <vmassol> or AndreasJonsson  
17:26 <evalica> vmassol:  yes - I've fixed the issue in http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-8324 . The solution to fix the blurring until the release is to define the button, menu and panels gradients in the ColorThemes  
17:26 <vmassol> actually AndreasJonsson you haven't done any release yet right? :)  
17:26 <vmassol> evalica: I'm not going to do that for 300 wikis… so if it's fixed automaitcally great ;)  
17:27 <vmassol> same for fmancinelli…  
17:30 <vmassol> hmm we have autowatch on xwiki.org?  
17:30 <vmassol> can't it be configured on a per user basis?  
17:30 <vmassol> (tmortagne)  
17:30 <tmortagne> vmassol: yes but it's enabled by default  
17:31 <vmassol> I don't see the UI to change it for my user  
17:31 <tmortagne> used to be in preferences  
17:31 <vmassol> tmortagne: by default it's off now right?  
17:31 <tmortagne> "it's enabled by default"  
17:31 <vmassol> (i mean in default distribs)  
17:31 <tmortagne> by default it's whatever is configured in conf file  
17:32 <vmassol> # xwiki.plugin.watchlist.automaticwatch=major  
17:32 <vmassol> hmm I thought we had agreed to have it off by default  
17:32 <tmortagne> seems like someone removed it from the user profile  
17:32 <tmortagne> ha no  
17:32 <tmortagne> watchlist tab  
17:32 <tmortagne> watchlist  
17:33 <vmassol> ah yes  
17:37 <tmortagne> has quit  
17:42 <vmassol> hmmm the ui looks broken here: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/Scripting?viewer=changes&rev1=44.1&rev2=45.1  
18:26 <vmassol> anyone knows why the livetable here doesn't display the creationDate: http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/IRC/WebHome ?  
18:26 <vmassol> looks like a bug  
18:26 <vmassol> ah no my bad  
18:31 <fmancinelli> has quit  
18:36 <sburjan> has quit  
18:47 <vmassol> I need some help  
18:47 <vmassol> I cannot convert this doc IRC.xwikiArchive20100205  
18:48 <vmassol> when I try to save modifications in it I get: "Caused by: java.sql.BatchUpdateException: Data truncation: Data too long for column 'XWL\_LINK' at row 1  
18:48 <vmassol> "  
18:50 <vmassol> hmm so it would mean there's a link in the page that's longer than 255 chars  
18:50 <vmassol> checking  
18:52 <vmassol> ok I have found a workaround  
18:53 <mrvanes> has quit  
18:53 <vmassol> I've cheated  
18:54 <vmassol> this is actually a problem….  
18:54 <vmassol> since we put IRC logs in page content, the parser will parse the whole content  
18:54 <vmassol> whereas in practice we only display them in a code macro  
19:20 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
19:23 <vmassol> ok all archives converted: http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/IRC/WebHome  
19:24 <vmassol> has quit  
19:27 <Slashman> has quit  
19:36 <evalica> has quit  
19:45 <jvdrean> has quit  
19:48 <mflorea> sdumitriu: ping  
19:48 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
19:48 <sdumitriu> Pong  
19:51 <mflorea> I transformed meta classes in components, and I choose to use as hint something like "String", "StaticList", and I updated the code to save this as the value of the classType XML field. Works fine, but there is one problem, it breaks the "expectation" of api.PropertyClass#getClassType and #getType  
19:52 <mflorea> the reason I choose to use "String" and not "com.xpn.xwiki.objects.classes.StringClass" is because I don't think it's good to have the impl class in the XML  
19:53 <mflorea> (ofc, I'm managing backwards compatibility with existing XARs by extracting the hint from the full class name)  
19:54 <sdumitriu> Right  
19:54 <mflorea> so my question is: should I keep the full Java class name as hint (and let it appear in XML) just to preserve the expectation of api.PropertyClass#getClassType and #getType or is it fine to break it?  
19:55 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
19:55 <mflorea> I'm thinking that the API user shouldn't care about the internal implementation of a property class  
19:55 <sdumitriu> I think that we should keep getClassType as it is  
19:55 <sdumitriu> But why do you say "hint"?  
19:56 <sdumitriu> getClassType returns getClass().getName();  
19:56 <dirk\_schmitt> One more migration issue:  
19:56 <dirk\_schmitt> http://www.computer42.org/~dirk/tmp/www.computer42.org%20screen%20capture%202012-10-18-19-50-16.jpg  
19:56 <dirk\_schmitt> The LDAP-Applications claims to be installed but isn't shown below "Applications".  
19:56 <mflorea> sdumitriu: I changed that in classes.PropertyClass to return  
19:56 <mflorea> StringUtils.removeEnd(getClass().getSimpleName(), "Class");  
19:57 <mflorea> which I use as hint for a component that gives me the prop and its meta class  
19:57 <sdumitriu> The API has getType for that  
19:58 <mflorea> again, there are two PropertyClass-es  
19:58 <mflorea> the api and the internal one  
19:59 <mflorea> the internal one has only getClassType, which used to return the full class name. I changed it to return the above, eg. "String", "StaticList", which I use as hint for my component  
19:59 <mflorea> and it works fine  
20:00 <dirk\_schmitt> The problem with the ldap application is fixed by uninstall & install the apllication  
20:00 <mflorea> i.e. when you export a class you don't see anymore  
20:00 <mflorea> <classType>com.xpn.xwiki.objects.classes.StringClass</classType>  
20:00 <mflorea> but  
20:00 <mflorea> <classType>String</classType>  
20:00 <sdumitriu> Yes, that should be good  
20:01 <mflorea> where "String" is a hint used to get a new prop instance  
20:01 <mflorea> so far so good  
20:01 <mflorea> but  
20:01 <sdumitriu> I know that I've been using the class in a few places  
20:01 <sdumitriu> (class editor)  
20:01 <mflorea> yes  
20:01 <mflorea> :)  
20:01 <mflorea> that's how I found about the api.PropertyClass issue  
20:01 <mflorea> I noticed that the prop don't have the icons  
20:02 <sdumitriu> It's used by $xwiki.getMetaclass  
20:02 <mflorea> because api.PropertyClass#getClassType doesn't return anymore the full class name but the hint  
20:03 <mflorea> yes, indeed, but the argument passed to $xwiki.metaClass.get(...) is taken from api.PropertyClass#getClassType  
20:03 <dirk\_schmitt> has quit  
20:03 <mflorea> so it works  
20:04 <mflorea> because MetaClass uses the given string as hint  
20:04 <vmassol> has quit  
20:05 <mflorea> ofc, if you have code where the class type is hardcoded, like  
20:05 <mflorea> $xwiki.metaclass.get('com.xpn...StringClass')  
20:05 <mflorea> it won't work  
20:06 <mflorea> so back to my question, its safer to use the full class name as hint (full backwards compatibility) but its uglier. I don't like that we include the impl class name in the XML  
20:09 <mflorea> I should send a mail  
20:12 <mflorea> has quit  
20:32 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki
